III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The facility is located at 1961 Lincoln, Highland Park, MI 48203. The consultant toured
the facility on 01/14/2008. The facility is a new building, located adjacent to the
corporation’s existing facility. The facility is completely separate from the existing
facility, however. These two facilities will share one common area, comprised of an
outdoor fenced courtyard, which will be used by both facilities as the outdoor meeting
area during fire emergencies. The facility consists of a main entrance area where metal
detectors are located, as well as locker rooms for male and female staff. Staff are
required to lock personal belongings into a locker prior to passing through the metal
detectors, where they are issues radios and keys at the start of each shift. The main
entrance is also where the control room is located. This room consists of monitors for
112 interior cameras and 15 outside cameras. Two staff are present to operate this
control room. These cameras videotape live 24 hours a day. The building contains
eight pods, or living units, consisting of ten single bedrooms each. Each pod is
designed similarly, and contains 10 bedrooms, a supervisory/administrative office area,
a therapy room, a social worker’s office, a living area, a classroom, teacher’s office, and
bathroom and shower area. Each two pods are connected by a locking door, and share
the supervisory/administrative office area. All offices are windowed, and the
supervisory/administrative area is windowed so that both entire pods can be viewed,
and contains interior offices for a supervisor, facility manager, storage rooms, and
medical supplies. The bedrooms consist of a bed, made up of a concrete slab with a
mattress and appropriate bed linen; a toilet, sink, and a concrete immovable desk and
stool. The bedroom doors have a window, and the interior of the rooms have a nightlight
for nighttime monitoring. Each bedroom is equipped with a red light over the doorway,
which lights when the door is not secured. There is a ninth unit, designated as the “Life
Safety Unit,” which also contains ten bedrooms. This unit will be used for residents to
stay temporarily who are ill, or are on high level of suicide precaution. The bedrooms
for this unit are video monitored. There is a second security station located in this unit.
There is a visitation area, consisting of eight visit rooms, and separate bathrooms. The
2

building has a medical unit, comprised of exam rooms, a nursing station, medication
room, a dental examination room, doctor’s office, and a psychiatrist’s office. The food
for residents is prepared in the adjacent facility, and is transported to the kitchen are of
this new facility. The kitchen area consists of prep areas and cleaning areas for dishes,
and has access to four dining rooms for residents through small glassed pass doors, by
which food and beverages are transferred. Each of the four dining rooms consists of
stationary tables and chairs, to accommodate a maximum of 20 residents. There is an
educational unit, where the school principal is located, along with rooms for school
supplies and meetings. There is ample staff training and event rooms, as well as staff
lounges. The entire facility is wireless, and each pod, classroom, and therapy room
contains flat screen video monitors for education, therapeutic and entertainment
purposes. There is a large gymnasium, an art room, and a large activity room. There is
an administrative area, where the chief administrator, administrative support staff, and
other building and program staff are located. There is also a secure loading area,
through which a van may enter and exit, for the purposes of transporting residents.
The facility also has a secure outdoor recreation area, with a 20-foot fence. This area
has designated space for both educational classes and therapy groups as well.
“A” ratings for both fire and environmental health inspections have been received.
Zoning approval has been received. A permanent certificate of occupancy has been
received.
B. Program Description
The program is a secure treatment facility, serving male delinquent juveniles, ages 12 to
17 years. The facility’s capacity is 80. The program will consist of case management
services for youth, in addition to clinical services including social work services,
individual, family and group therapy, and psychiatric care. The program will provide
daily nursing coverage, and will contract with two psychiatrists and a physician who will
treat residents. Dental services will also be provided onsite. The treatment program will
consist of a structured daily schedule, during which residents will work to progress
through a level system toward achieving successful completion of the program.
Progress will include the incorporation and development of educational skills, daily living
skills, restitution, and achieving therapeutic goals. The program structure will include a
team approach, consisting of direct care staff, supervisors, clinical and administrative
staff, as well as family and referral sources. Staff to resident ratio is 2:10. A minimum
of three supervisory/administrative staff will be on duty at all times.
The program policies and procedures were reviewed and were determined to be
incompliance with licensing rules/statues.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
There are no rule/statutory violations.

I recommend issuance of a provisional license to this child caring institution, private.
